chapter.title: Working with Process Locks
chapter.para: The Process Locks view shows the existing process locks. Using the web interface, you can display information about existing process locks and remove any process lock.
The following actions are supported in the Proces Locks view:

sect1.title: Listing Process Locks
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the existing process locks in the Process Locks view.
The overview table displays the following information for each process lock by default:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the process lock.
The following values are currently valid.
The blocking process only requires read permissions. Other processes can also have read access.
The locking process requires read and write permissions.
The unique identifier of the job that is affected by the process lock.
Date and time (time stamp) of the process lock creation.

sect1.title: Displaying Process Lock Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific process lock in the details pane as follows: The details pane contains the same scope of information as the overview table.

sect1.title: Deleting Process Locks
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single process lock or multiple process locks. Proceed as follows to delete existing process locks:

step.para: Go to the Process Locks view.
Select at least one process lock from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete.
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Process Locks opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Processes, click OK to delete the selected process (or processes).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Processes, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected process(es).

result.para: If the process locks have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed.
If the process lock could not be deleted, a corresponding error message is displayed.
